intro: Ittnera major, commonly known as the green sand tree, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and striking greenish-yellow bark. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in complex inflorescences. Ittnera major is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments with high rainfall. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
